docs.snippet: Three people who were arrested after Dakota Access pipeline protesters rappelled from the roof of the Minnesota Vikings' stadium to unfurl a banner were released from jail Monday with charges pending....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three people who were arrested after Dakota Access pipeline protesters rappelled from the roof of the Minnesota Vikings' stadium to unfurl a banner were released from jail Monday with charges pending.

headline.main: 3 Released in Dakota Access Pipeline Stadium Protest
headline.print_headline: 3 Released in Dakota Access Pipeline Stadium Protest

docs.snippet: South Korea has banned the sale of 10 models of Nissan, BMW and Porsche vehicles after the carmakers were found to have fabricated certification documents, in the latest fallout from the Volkswagen emissions scandal....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Korea has banned the sale of 10 models of Nissan, BMW and Porsche vehicles after the carmakers were found to have fabricated certification documents, in the latest fallout from the Volkswagen emissions scandal.

headline.main: South Korea Bans Sales of Some Nissan, BMW and Porsche Models
headline.print_headline: South Korea Bans Sales of Some Nissan, BMW and Porsche Models

docs.snippet: Monsignor Hilarion Capucci, 94, was a Greek Melkite Catholic archbishop in Jerusalem when Israel convicted him in 1976 of using his diplomatic status to smuggle arms to Palestinian militants in the West Bank....

docs.snippet: Sampdoria forward Fabio Quagliarella would like to settle down and end his career at the Genoa-based club after switching teams several times in his career, he told Sky Sport on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sampdoria forward Fabio Quagliarella would like to settle down and end his career at the Genoa-based club after switching teams several times in his career, he told Sky Sport on Monday.

headline.main: Much-Travelled Quagliarella Wants to Extend Sampdoria Stay
headline.print_headline: Much-Travelled Quagliarella Wants to Extend Sampdoria Stay

docs.snippet: A senior Egyptian judge arrested on corruption charges was found dead in his cell on Monday having hanged himself, his lawyer said....

docs.snippet: Argentina has loosened regulations to allow more competition in its telecoms sector and widen internet penetration, according to a decree published on Monday that the government hopes will attract billions of dollars in investments....
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina has loosened regulations to allow more competition in its telecoms sector and widen internet penetration, according to a decree published on Monday that the government hopes will attract billions of dollars in investments.

headline.main: Argentina Decrees Telecoms Rule Changes to Increase Competition
